abstract: Zooms out from the content at the specified point.
overview:
## Return Value

[doc://com.apple.objectivec/documentation/ObjectiveC/YES] if this method successfully handles zooming; otherwise, [doc://com.apple.objectivec/documentation/ObjectiveC/NO]. By default, this method returns [doc://com.apple.objectivec/documentation/ObjectiveC/NO].

## Discussion

If your element has the [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/UIKit/UIAccessibilityTraits/supportsZoom] trait, you need to implement this method and [doc://com.apple.objectivec/documentation/ObjectiveC/NSObject-swift.class/accessibilityZoomIn(at:)]. Use this method to zoom out from the specified point. For example, if the element allows a pinch gesture to zoom out from the view’s content, implement this method so that the VoiceOver zoom action receives the same behavior.

# accessibilityZoomOut(at:)

**Instance Method**

Zooms out from the content at the specified point.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor func accessibilityZoomOut(at point: CGPoint) -> Bool
```

## Parameters

- **point**: The point where a person performs the zoom out action.

## Return Value

[doc://com.apple.objectivec/documentation/ObjectiveC/YES] if this method successfully handles zooming; otherwise, [doc://com.apple.objectivec/documentation/ObjectiveC/NO]. By default, this method returns [doc://com.apple.objectivec/documentation/ObjectiveC/NO].

## Discussion

If your element has the [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/UIKit/UIAccessibilityTraits/supportsZoom] trait, you need to implement this method and [doc://com.apple.objectivec/documentation/ObjectiveC/NSObject-swift.class/accessibilityZoomIn(at:)]. Use this method to zoom out from the specified point. For example, if the element allows a pinch gesture to zoom out from the view’s content, implement this method so that the VoiceOver zoom action receives the same behavior.
